name: faucet
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
B1 a device that controls the flow of liquid, especially water, from a pipe: How fast does water flow out of your kitchen faucet? the hot/cold faucetturn on/off the faucet To avoid infection, use a paper towel to turn on/off the faucet.open/close the faucet When you open your faucet you may get a reduced water flow. Synonym
spigot
Sam Edwards/OJO Images/GettyImages
something that allows a supply of something such as money, information, or people to flow: The tide turned in the investigation when one gang member became an informant, and once somebody opened the faucet, it broke the case open. We don't have rich parents — there is no money faucet for us.
More examplesFewer examplesShe closed the faucet running the shower, not wanting to waste water.Hundreds of tourists poured from the ferry as if someone had opened a faucet.Every time a visitor spends a dollar at hotels, theme parks and shops, that money trickles through the community, and when those dollars stop coming in, the faucet turns off.They were caught off-guard when their salaries and bonuses were cut drastically and their money faucet abruptly dried up.
